medical_history.chief_complaint: Weakness of the right arm followed by disturbance of consciousness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 hours after playing tennis, leading to disturbances in consciousness, aphasia, Gerstmann syndrome, and right hemiparesis. Symptoms gradually improved and disappeared 1 month after the event.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS) Type IV, which presents features such as prominent eyes, lobeless ears, thin lips, and hyperextensible skin. Histological examination confirmed changes compatible with EDS Type IV.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father and elder brother demonstrated similar features of EDS. No history of easy bruising or vascular events in the family.
